intro: Rhododendron pentaphyllum var. shikokianum, commonly known as the Shikokian azalea, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Shikoku, Japan. It features dense, dark green foliage and produces clusters of showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and has a compact, bushy habit. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
